Description: Implementing role-based authentication and authorization involves defining user roles and permissions to control access to resources within the infrastructure. This ensures that users have only the necessary permissions to perform their tasks, minimizing the risk of unauthorized access.
Implementing simple access control for systems involves setting up basic authentication and authorization mechanisms to restrict access to authorized users only.
Implementing Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) adds an additional layer of security by requiring users to provide multiple forms of verification before gaining access.
Implementing MFA for admins involves requiring administrative users to authenticate using multiple factors, enhancing the security of privileged accounts.

Activity: Ad-Hoc Security trainings for software developers
Description: Conducting ad-hoc security trainings for software developers involves providing occasional training sessions focused on security best practices and awareness to enhance the security skills of the development team.

Activity: Conduction of build-it, break-it, fix-it contests
Description: Conducting build-it, break-it, fix-it contests involves organizing events where teams build applications, attempt to break them by identifying vulnerabilities, and then fix the issues. This hands-on approach promotes practical security skills and fosters a culture of continuous improvement.

Organizing office hours involves setting aside dedicated time for team members to seek guidance, ask questions, and discuss security-related concerns with security experts or coaches, promoting an open and supportive security culture.
Providing regular security training for all employees ensures that everyone is aware of security policies, best practices, and emerging threats, fostering a security-conscious organizational culture.

Conducting regular security training for externals, such as contractors or third-party vendors, ensures that they adhere to the organization's security standards and understand their responsibilities in maintaining security.

Communicating information security targets involves clearly conveying the organization's security goals, policies, and expectations to all stakeholders, ensuring alignment and understanding across the board.

Aligning security in teams involves integrating security objectives and responsibilities into the workflows and culture of various teams, ensuring that security is a shared responsibility and is embedded in daily operations.

Grouping of metrics involves categorizing various monitoring metrics into logical groups based on their relevance and functionality. This helps in organizing data for better analysis and reporting, ensuring that related metrics are viewed together for more insightful monitoring.

Tools.name: Grafana
Tools.description: Open-source platform for monitoring and observability with robust metric grouping and visualization capabilities.

Tools.name: Prometheus
Tools.description: Open-source monitoring system and time series database that allows for effective metric grouping and querying.

Tools.name: Datadog
Tools.description: Monitoring and analytics platform that supports grouping of metrics for comprehensive dashboards.

Tools.name: New Relic
Tools.description: Application performance monitoring tool with capabilities to group and visualize metrics effectively.

Tools.name: Zabbix
Tools.description: Enterprise-class open-source monitoring solution that supports metric grouping and comprehensive dashboards.

Tools.name: Nagios
Tools.description: Open-source monitoring tool that allows for the grouping and alerting of related metrics.

Tools.name: ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana)
Tools.description: Comprehensive logging and monitoring solution that facilitates the grouping and visualization of metrics.

Description: Screens with metric visualization involve creating dashboards and graphical representations of monitoring data to provide real-time insights into system performance, security, and operational health.

Tools.name: Grafana
Tools.description: Open-source platform for creating interactive and visually appealing dashboards for metric visualization.

Tools.name: Kibana
Tools.description: Visualization tool for the ELK Stack, used to create dashboards and graphs from log and metric data.

Tools.name: Splunk
Tools.description: Platform for searching, monitoring, and analyzing machine-generated data with advanced visualization features.

Tools.name: Datadog
Tools.description: Monitoring and analytics platform with robust dashboard and visualization capabilities.

Tools.name: New Relic
Tools.description: Application performance monitoring tool that offers comprehensive dashboards for metric visualization.

Tools.name: Graylog
Tools.description: Open-source log management platform with dashboard and visualization features.

Tools.name: Prometheus
Tools.description: Open-source monitoring system that integrates with Grafana for advanced metric visualization.

Description: Targeted alerting involves configuring alerts to notify relevant stakeholders about specific events or thresholds that require attention. This ensures that alerts are meaningful and actionable, reducing alert fatigue and improving response times.

Tools.name: Prometheus Alertmanager
Tools.description: Handles alerts sent by Prometheus server and manages silencing, inhibition, and routing of alerts.

Tools.name: Grafana Alerting
Tools.description: Integrated alerting system within Grafana for creating and managing alerts based on dashboard metrics.

Tools.name: Datadog Alerts
Tools.description: Provides customizable alerting based on various metrics and events within the Datadog platform.

Tools.name: PagerDuty
Tools.description: Incident management platform that integrates with monitoring tools to deliver targeted alerts and manage responses.

Tools.name: OpsGenie
Tools.description: Alerting and incident management tool that integrates with various monitoring solutions for targeted alerting.

Tools.name: Nagios
Tools.description: Open-source monitoring tool that supports configurable alerting for various system metrics and events.

Tools.name: Zabbix
Tools.description: Enterprise-class open-source monitoring solution with advanced alerting and notification features.

Activity: Integration of vulnerability issues into the development process
Description: Integrating vulnerability issues into the development process involves embedding security checks and vulnerability assessments into the software development lifecycle (SDLC). This ensures that vulnerabilities are identified and addressed early, promoting a proactive approach to security.

Tools.name: Jira
Tools.description: Project management tool that can track and manage vulnerability issues as part of the development process.

Tools.name: GitHub Issues
Tools.description: Issue tracking system integrated with GitHub repositories for managing vulnerability reports.

Tools.name: GitLab Issues
Tools.description: Issue tracking feature within GitLab for managing and integrating vulnerability issues.

Tools.name: Azure DevOps Boards
Tools.description: Work tracking system within Azure DevOps for managing vulnerability issues and integration into development workflows.

Tools.name: SonarQube
Tools.description: Continuous inspection tool that identifies vulnerabilities and integrates with development pipelines.

Tools.name: Snyk
Tools.description: Developer-first security tool that finds and fixes vulnerabilities in dependencies and container images.

Tools.name: WhiteSource
Tools.description: Open-source security and license compliance management tool integrated into development processes.

Description: Simple false positive treatment involves identifying and dismissing alerts or findings that are incorrectly flagged as vulnerabilities. This helps in reducing noise and focusing on genuine security issues.

Tools.name: SonarQube
Tools.description: Continuous inspection tool that allows for marking certain alerts as false positives to reduce noise.

Tools.name: Snyk
Tools.description: Developer-first security tool that enables users to dismiss false positive vulnerability findings.

Tools.name: WhiteSource
Tools.description: Manages false positives in vulnerability reports and allows for customizable filtering.

Tools.name: GitHub Advanced Security
Tools.description: Provides features to mark certain security alerts as false positives within GitHub repositories.

Tools.name: GitLab Security
Tools.description: Offers the ability to dismiss or mark security findings as false positives within GitLab projects.

Tools.name: ESLint
Tools.description: Linting tool for JavaScript that can be configured to ignore certain warnings or errors.

Tools.name: IDE Plugins (e.g., PyCharm, VSCode)
Tools.description: Integrated development environment plugins that allow developers to mark specific findings as false positives.

Description: Dead code elimination involves identifying and removing portions of code that are never executed or are redundant. This helps in reducing the codebase size, improving maintainability, and minimizing potential security vulnerabilities associated with unused code.

Tools.name: SonarQube
Tools.description: Continuous inspection tool that detects dead code among other code quality issues.

Tools.name: ESLint
Tools.description: Linting tool for JavaScript that identifies unused variables and dead code.

Tools.name: PyLint
Tools.description: Static code analysis tool for Python that detects dead code and unused variables.

Tools.name: Coverity
Tools.description: Static analysis tool that identifies dead code and other code quality issues.

Tools.name: FindBugs
Tools.description: Static analysis tool for Java that helps detect dead code and potential bugs.

Tools.name: PMD
Tools.description: Source code analyzer that identifies dead code and other potential issues in Java, JavaScript, and other languages.

Tools.name: Unused
Tools.description: Tool for identifying and removing unused code in various programming languages.

Tools.name: Visual Studio Code Extensions
Tools.description: Extensions available for VSCode that help detect and remove dead code in multiple languages.

Description: Exclusion of source code duplicates involves identifying and removing duplicated code segments within the codebase. This enhances code maintainability, reduces the risk of inconsistencies, and minimizes the surface area for potential vulnerabilities.

Tools.name: SonarQube
Tools.description: Continuous inspection tool that detects code duplication and other code quality issues.

Tools.name: PMD
Tools.description: Source code analyzer that identifies duplicate code and other potential issues in various languages.

Tools.name: Checkstyle
Tools.description: Static code analysis tool for Java that can detect duplicated code segments.

Tools.name: CodeClimate
Tools.description: Platform that offers code analysis for duplication, complexity, and other quality metrics.

Tools.name: Simian
Tools.description: Tool for detecting duplicate code in multiple programming languages.

Tools.name: DupFinder
Tools.description: Tool by JetBrains for finding duplicate code in .NET projects.

Tools.name: IntelliJ IDEA's Built-in Duplicate Detection
Tools.description: Integrated feature within IntelliJ IDEA IDE to detect and manage duplicate code.

Description: Testing for patch deployment time involves measuring the duration it takes to deploy security patches across the infrastructure. This ensures that patches are applied promptly to mitigate vulnerabilities effectively.

Tools.name: Jenkins
Tools.description: Automation server that can orchestrate and track patch deployment pipelines.

Tools.name: GitLab CI/CD
Tools.description: Continuous integration and delivery tool integrated with GitLab repositories for managing patch deployments.

Tools.name: Azure DevOps
Tools.description: Set of development tools with CI/CD pipelines for automating patch deployments.

Tools.name: Ansible
Tools.description: Automation tool for orchestrating patch deployments across multiple systems.

Tools.name: Puppet
Tools.description: Configuration management tool that can automate patch deployments and track their progress.

Tools.name: Chef
Tools.description: Automation platform for managing infrastructure and deploying patches efficiently.

Tools.name: Rundeck
Tools.description: Automation service for running patch deployment jobs and tracking their execution times.

Description: Testing for Time to Patch involves measuring the time taken from identifying a vulnerability to successfully applying a patch. This metric helps in assessing the efficiency of the patch management process.

Tools.name: Jira
Tools.description: Project management tool that can track vulnerability identification and patch application timelines.

Tools.name: ServiceNow
Tools.description: IT service management tool that can be configured to track time to patch metrics.

Tools.name: Azure DevOps
Tools.description: Set of development tools with built-in analytics to track patch deployment times.

Tools.name: GitLab CI/CD
Tools.description: Continuous integration and delivery tool that can automate and measure patch deployment processes.

Tools.name: Splunk
Tools.description: Platform for monitoring and analyzing patch deployment times through log data.

Description: Testing libyear involves assessing the longevity and maintenance status of third-party libraries and dependencies used within the application. This ensures that libraries are actively maintained, receive timely security updates, and are compatible with the application's future development.

Tools.name: libyear
Tools.description: Tool that analyzes the maintenance status and activity of open-source libraries.

Tools.name: Depfu
Tools.description: Service that monitors dependencies for updates and security vulnerabilities.

Tools.name: Snyk
Tools.description: Developer-first security tool that scans for vulnerabilities in dependencies and monitors library health.

Tools.name: WhiteSource
Tools.description: Open-source security and license compliance management tool that monitors library maintenance.

Tools.name: Dependabot
Tools.description: GitHub-integrated tool that automatically creates pull requests to update dependencies.

Tools.name: Renovate
Tools.description: Automated tool that manages and updates dependencies across various languages and platforms.

Tools.name: Sonatype Nexus
Tools.description: Repository manager that also provides insights into dependency health and maintenance.

Activity: Conduction of simple threat modeling on technical level
Description: Conducting simple threat modeling on a technical level involves identifying potential security threats and vulnerabilities in the system's architecture and design. This helps in proactively addressing security concerns during the design phase.

Creating advanced abuse stories involves developing detailed and complex scenarios where malicious actors attempt to exploit system vulnerabilities. These stories help in understanding potential attack vectors, enhancing security measures, and improving incident response strategies.

Creating simple abuse stories involves developing basic scenarios where attackers exploit common vulnerabilities. These stories assist in identifying fundamental security gaps and informing the development of effective security controls.

Activity: Creation of threat modeling processes and standards
Description: Creating threat modeling processes and standards involves establishing structured methodologies and guidelines for identifying, assessing, and mitigating security threats during the system design and development phases. This ensures consistency and thoroughness in threat modeling efforts across the organization.

Adopting a microservice architecture involves structuring an application as a collection of loosely coupled, independently deployable services. This approach enhances scalability, flexibility, and resilience, but also introduces new security considerations such as inter-service communication, service discovery, and container security.

Tools.name: Kubernetes
Tools.description: Container orchestration system that manages the deployment, scaling, and operations of application containers.

Tools.name: Docker
Tools.description: Platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers, essential for microservice deployments.

Tools.name: Istio
Tools.description: Service mesh that provides a uniform way to secure, connect, and observe microservices.

Tools.name: Linkerd
Tools.description: Lightweight service mesh for Kubernetes, focusing on simplicity and performance.

Tools.name: Consul
Tools.description: Service networking solution that provides service discovery, configuration, and segmentation.

Tools.name: Envoy
Tools.description: High-performance proxy designed for cloud-native applications, used in service meshes.

Tools.name: Helm
Tools.description: Package manager for Kubernetes that simplifies the deployment and management of microservices.

Activity: Conduction of collaborative team security checks
Description: Conducting collaborative team security checks involves teams working together to review and assess the security posture of their applications and infrastructure. This collaborative approach fosters a shared responsibility for security, enhances knowledge sharing, and ensures that diverse perspectives are considered in identifying and mitigating security risks.

Activity: Conduction of collaborative security checks with developers and system administrators
Description: Conducting collaborative security checks with developers and system administrators involves joint efforts to evaluate and enhance the security measures of applications and infrastructure. This collaboration ensures that both development and operations teams are aligned on security best practices, facilitates the identification of vulnerabilities, and promotes a culture of continuous security improvement.

Conducting security code reviews involves systematically examining source code to identify and remediate security vulnerabilities. This practice ensures that code adheres to security best practices and reduces the risk of introducing vulnerabilities into the application.

Tools.name: SonarQube
Tools.description: Continuous inspection tool that analyzes code for security vulnerabilities and code quality issues.

Tools.name: Checkmarx
Tools.description: Static Application Security Testing (SAST) tool that scans code for security vulnerabilities.

Tools.name: Fortify
Tools.description: Comprehensive application security testing tool that identifies vulnerabilities in source code.

Tools.name: Snyk
Tools.description: Developer-first security tool that finds and fixes vulnerabilities in dependencies and container images.

Tools.name: GitHub CodeQL
Tools.description: Semantic code analysis engine for identifying vulnerabilities in codebases hosted on GitHub.

Tools.name: GitLab SAST
Tools.description: Static Application Security Testing integrated within GitLab for scanning code for vulnerabilities.

Tools.name: ESLint
Tools.description: Linting tool for JavaScript that can be configured with security-focused rules.

Description: Analyzing logs involves examining system and application log data to identify patterns, detect anomalies, and uncover potential security incidents. This practice is crucial for incident detection, troubleshooting, and ensuring compliance with security policies.

Tools.name: ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana)
Tools.description: Comprehensive logging and monitoring solution for collecting, searching, and visualizing logs.

Tools.name: Splunk
Tools.description: Platform for searching, monitoring, and analyzing machine-generated data, including logs.

Tools.name: Graylog
Tools.description: Open-source log management platform with advanced log analysis and visualization capabilities.

Tools.name: Fluentd
Tools.description: Open-source data collector for unified logging and log processing.

Tools.name: Loggly
Tools.description: Cloud-based log management and analytics service for real-time log analysis.

Tools.name: Papertrail
Tools.description: Cloud-hosted log management service for centralized log analysis and monitoring.

Tools.name: Datadog Logs
Tools.description: Logging service integrated with Datadog's monitoring platform for comprehensive log analysis.

Description: Testing virtualized environments involves verifying that virtual machines and containers are configured securely and operate within defined security parameters. This ensures that the virtual infrastructure is resilient, compliant with security standards, and free from misconfigurations that could lead to vulnerabilities.

Tools.name: VMware vSphere
Tools.description: Virtualization platform for managing virtual machines and ensuring secure configurations.

Tools.name: VirtualBox
Tools.description: Open-source virtualization tool for testing and verifying virtual environments.

Tools.name: Docker
Tools.description: Platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers, essential for virtual environment testing.

Tools.name: Kubernetes
Tools.description: Container orchestration system that facilitates the testing and validation of containerized environments.

Tools.name: Ansible
Tools.description: Automation tool for configuring and managing virtual environments securely.

Tools.name: Puppet
Tools.description: Configuration management tool that automates the provisioning and hardening of virtual environments.

Tools.name: Chef
Tools.description: Automation platform for managing infrastructure and ensuring secure virtual environment configurations.

Tools.name: Terraform
Tools.description: Infrastructure as Code tool that supports the provisioning and testing of secure virtual environments.

Description: Application Hardening Level 1 involves implementing basic security measures to protect applications from common vulnerabilities. This includes practices such as input validation, secure authentication mechanisms, encryption of sensitive data, and adherence to secure coding standards.

App. Hardening Level 1 (50%) indicates partial implementation of basic security measures to protect applications. This may involve addressing some but not all common vulnerabilities, ensuring that foundational security practices are in place while further hardening is still required.

Hardening of the environment involves implementing advanced security measures to secure the infrastructure and systems. This includes configuring firewalls, applying security patches, enforcing strict access controls, disabling unnecessary services, and implementing intrusion detection systems.

Implementing an advanced Web Application Firewall (WAF) involves configuring and deploying sophisticated WAF solutions to protect web applications from a wide range of threats, including SQL injection, cross-site scripting (XSS), and other OWASP Top Ten vulnerabilities.

Performing local development security checks involves integrating security scans and validations into the local development environment to identify and remediate vulnerabilities early in the development process.

Tools.name: ESLint
Tools.description: Linting tool for JavaScript that can be configured with security-focused rules.

Tools.name: PyLint
Tools.description: Static code analysis tool for Python that detects security vulnerabilities and code quality issues.

Tools.name: SonarLint
Tools.description: IDE extension that provides real-time feedback on code quality and security issues.

Tools.name: Brakeman
Tools.description: Static analysis tool specifically for Ruby on Rails applications to detect security vulnerabilities.

Tools.name: Checkmarx
Tools.description: Static Application Security Testing (SAST) tool that scans code for security vulnerabilities.

Description: Conducting weak password tests involves assessing the strength of passwords used within the infrastructure to ensure they meet security standards and are resistant to brute-force or guessing attacks.

Tools.name: Hydra
Tools.description: Parallelized login cracker supporting numerous protocols to test password strength.

Tools.name: John the Ripper
Tools.description: Popular password cracking tool used to test the strength of passwords.

Tools.name: Hashcat
Tools.description: Advanced password recovery tool supporting GPU acceleration for efficient password strength testing.

Tools.name: Burp Suite
Tools.description: Web vulnerability scanner that includes password strength testing features.

Tools.name: OWASP ZAP
Tools.description: Open-source web application security scanner that can be configured for password strength testing.
